intro: Duvalia radiata var. minor, commonly known as the lesser radiated duvalia, is a lesser-known species within the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its slender stems and trifoliate leaves. The flowers are typically small and clustered, with a distinctive yellowish or white coloration. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and rarity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
